DataElement.preferredName: Conceptual Parent Tissue Biospecimen Investigational Key Barcode Identifier Record Date/Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date and time the experimental key was recorded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Conceptual Parent Tissue Biospecimen Barcode Identifier Record
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.

Concepts.definition: A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Display format: MM/DD/YYYY HR:MN; Use NCIt based Rep Class
